dialogues.text: (after a beat) I flew airplanes. EXT. AIRFIELD -— EDWARDS AIRFORCE BASE - FLASHBACK (1961 CLOSE ON: AVIATOR BOOTS crossing a tarmac. SUPER: Edwards Airforce Base, California, 1961

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Aix Force naviator. Test pilot. Shortlisted for the Mercury Space program... WIDEN: Larry Trainor strides across the airfield in full, orbital-appropriate, test pilot gear. Heads for...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «..an Atomic Age sex machine. ..-THE X-15, an experimental ROCKET PLANE attached to the underbelly of a NASA B-52 mothership. His Ground Crew Chief, JOHN BOWERS, falls in next to him they do a sight inspect the X-15.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: How’s my X-15?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Fifty-seven thousand pounds-force of thrust, Mach 6, like riding a rocket ship between your thighs. She’s a beast.

dialogues.speaker: INT, X-15/C-22
dialogues.text: Larry sits in the rumbling cockpit of the X-15, still attached to the mothership. Aloft.

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Five seconds, zero-zero-eight.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Roger, two, one, launch. The X-15 is drop launched, its rocket engine ignites, Lar shoots into the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, we got a good light here, Larry. Check your alpha and your heading. MOMENTS LATER. WITH LARRY. His plane hurtles upwards at Mach 6. Approaches 130,000 feet above the Earth...

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Count at twelve now... got twelve- six... and thirteen...

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Very sensitive. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mach still good. The sky behind him darkens as he approaches sub-orbital atmosphere and sees, laid out in front of him: the curvat of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Sweet mother of God. His reverie is broken by a looming, shimmering mass (thin Aurora Borealis)... His plane flies right through it... b now the shimmery lights are inside his cockpit... LARRY (CONT‘’D) Hold on. Matter strike. (off the dials) Everything seems to be fine. The X-15 suddenly starts to spin. Larry remains calm. LARRY (CONT’D) Gone squirrelly. I’m in a spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and the other members of the ground crew listen to t ground-to-air crosstalk. Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let’s watch your theta, Larry.

dialogues.text: I'm in a spin. INT. TRAINOR HOUSE — DAY — FLASHBACK (1961 A woman, SHERYL TRAINOR serves breakfast to two kids. A FAMILY PICTURE includes Larry. Husband, Dad.

dialogues.text: Larry blacks out! As the rocket plane spins to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Let’s pull it up... Put some g on it, Larry...

dialogues.text: JOHN slams out of the shed, races for the motor pool. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AIR CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you read, Larry?

dialogues.speaker: WITH LARRY IN THE X
dialogues.text: Larry, still unconscious. The plane hurtles down. When, inexplicably - Larry’s chest begins to glow from within. As SOMETHING - that BLACK, ELECTRICAL MASS we recognize f earlier ~- springs from his torso, like another life forc exiting him. Just as-- The X-15 SLAMS into the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl steps outside the screen door to the front yard, w neighbors in the street are looking off, to the airfield, where a plume of smoke rises in the air.

dialogues.speaker: THE BURNING WRECKAGE
dialogues.text: Through the flames we see Larry’s body. Dead. As now, that black electrical mass, almost humanoid in sh call it THE NEGATIVE SPIRIT - floats down to the flames—- ~-and re-enters Larry’s body as we-- RISE UP, through the smoke, to see ARMY VEHICLES racing a them from across the field. WITH JOHN in the lead jeep as they arrive at the wreckage But there’s no way. No way Larry could have survived... Until-- Larry shuffles out from the burning wreckage, ful aflame, charred, grotesque. But alive.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kill me, but I sort of like Larry Trainor’s origin tale. All stare. Stunned. INT. DOOM MANOR — SOLARIUM ~ NIGHT (1995 cliff stands in front REHAB STAIRS. Three steps up, three down. Handrails. Larry watches. Cliff lifts a foot - CLANK! It bangs against the bottom step. Across the room, Rita knits. Another cocktail beside her. Flinches at every grating CLANK! TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RITA \
dialogues.text: It is so important what you’re doing, Cliff. (please stop) But you know, there’s always tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Larry) What's Drinky’s deal?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Rita? She was an actress. She prefers the light here in the afternoon. (to Rita) Looking terrific today, Rita! Rita holds up her drink in droll thanks. She knows. CLANK! Cliff just can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Cliff? Sometimes it helps to picture a place you'd like to go.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: How ‘bout up the freakin’ steps?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (a quiet challenge) Why go up the steps at all?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I_can’t walk. I can’t fly, I can’t feel. I can’t eat, I can’t smell, I can’t shit, I can’t fuck and I’d like to be able to do one fucking thing for myself when I kiss you and the other Munster here the sweet fuck goodbye. Rita and Larry react. Oh.

dialogues.text: Daddy? Cliff whips his head toward the stairs... HIS DAUGHTER CL sits on the lowest step. She waves. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 22.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now she’s gone. Cliff reacts -- what the--?

dialogues.speaker: NILES, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Seeing your daughter, that’s good! INT, DOOM MANOR — CHIEF'S OFFICE - DAY (1995 Cliff and Niles. Niles tests bending Cliff's legs and ank with a remote control.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: That means the memories are coming back. Maybe she’s just the inspiration you need. Whirr. Whirr. Up, back. Up, back...

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever left this place?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Some have. Some come and go. Others, like Larry and Rita, prefer to stay. Rita has her knitting, Larry, his horticulture. To be perfectly honest with you, those who leave find it’s often more difficult for the world out there to accept who they've become than they do. (then, re: the tests) In better news, I can see no Mechanical reason you shouldn't be able to walk. (then) Keep going, Cliff. You’re almost there. ON CLIFF. The THRUM OF RACE CAR ENGINES consumes him as-- INT. DOOM MANOR — SOLARIUM - DAY (1995 Cliff watches NASCAR on TV. Planted on the sofa like a bookend. QUICK POP: Cliff in his race car, in the thick of it. RESUME CLIFF. Rita enters, carrying her drink and a roast chicken. Afternoon snack.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be not- walking? TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: You used to do this?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Around and around... that’s it?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah. (after a beat) You were in the movies?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super: Africa, 1955. Moving through a 1950s movie set - a bush camp (think “Ki Solomon’s Mines”) - shooting on location in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lovely, Rita. Queen of 50s cinema. Some critics called her the poor man’s Deborah Kerr, some critics called her the rich man's Yvette Vickers. (another tired sigh) Critics. What do they know? They’re gonna hate this show. And landing on our star, Rita, in early-50s explorer garb with pith helmet. The cameras are rolling, she writes a letter at a campaign table.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (as she writes) Dearest Mother. Today was a fine hunt in the bush. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Rita’s attention is slowly diverted to the FOCUS PULLER, is missing one arm. She can’t unsee it.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: fom took down a kudu, whose horns will look magnificent in the-- (breaking character) Sorry. (composes herself) --whose horns will look-- She freezes, unable to take her eyes off of that arm. EXT, FILM SET #1 — DAY — FLASHBACK (1955 Rita, puffed up now, walks through the production with th FIRST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST AD
dialogues.text: Rita, please. He’s the best focus puller in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: He’s an eyesore, Charles, a real liability.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST AD
dialogues.text: What if we covered up the arm. A different set of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Get_rid of him.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST AD
dialogues.text: (weakly) But - the crew. They adore him.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: So put his name on the marquee. Rita enters her tent. The First AD sighs. Turns to face many of the crew, who heard it all. INT. FILM SET #1 - RITA‘S TENT - FLASHBACK (1955 Rita brushes her hair in front of her mirror. There’s a commotion outside. Yelling. Shouts of disapproval. Rita does her best to ignore them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First AD leads Rita through the crew to her marks by roaring river. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 25.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is the big caravan scene -- Rita and her caravan of explorers will cross the river. As she passes through the crew, she is met with unmistakable coldness.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST AD
dialogues.text: Now, Rita, you’ll step out onto these rocks here, the crocodile will turn up there, you’1ll scream bloody murder and Joe’ll blast ‘er to Betsy, Think you can handle it? Rita glances at the camera crew, staring bullets at her. There's a strapping new FOCUS PULLER. Shiny and whole.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s fine, it’s totally fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later; The scene rolls. The caravan crosses. Rita tentatively steps out on the rocks, a CREWMAN readies the fake crocodile just out of frame...

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Now just one more rock, Rita, there you go, like it’s a lovely day and-- ...-but as Rita steps on the last rock, it sinks! Rita go under water!

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: She sinks into a deeper sinkhole, flails to get her beari Claws at rocks on either side of her...

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM CREW
dialogues.text: Watches the bubbling water. Nobody moves a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST AD
dialogues.text: Why are you standing there? Help her! Help her! As crew members reluctantly spring into action--

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: She pulls at the rocks... one loosens from the pile, a MU COLORED DYE, like octopus ink, shoots into her face, her widen in fear ag the dye consumes her, clouds the entire sinkhole, obscures her from view... TV Calling - For educational purposes only

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM CREW
dialogues.text: Has poles and such in the water, trying to give her anyth to grab onto, as Rita bursts above water, gasps for air, The crew pulls her out of the water, she stands there, sh and drenched. Her back is to us.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I’m fine, I’m totally fine. Towel. For a beat, nobody moves. The crew stares at her, agog. RITA (CONT’D) What’s wrong with you? Never gone for a swim? Towel. The Wardrobe Gal approaches with a towel. Freaked.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What_are you staring at! The Wardrobe Gal meekly produces a compact mirror. Shows Rita her face... we just see a small piece, the side of h eye seems to... droop? Rita takes the girl’s arm, directs the mirror for a better look. As WE ARM AROUND T0 SEE-- Rita. Half her face, collapsed, like some monstrous candl dripping. It’s horrible. The Wardrobe Gal begins to sob. The new Focus Puller begi to retch... Rita, mortified, looks for escape... only to realize her foot has swollen to grotesque proportions. Still, she walks off, an ungainly shuffle, tears running her cheeks. Away from them all.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And away she ran. Monstrous Rita. INT. DOOM MANOR - SOLARIUM — DAY (1995 Rita sits there for a moment, in reverie.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eventually finding her way to the only place she would ever feel safe and unjudged. Sitting next to a brain... WE WIDEN to include Cliff, as she lifts the entire roast chicken sitting in front of her, takes a huge bite. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

Rita puts down her knitting. #nough is enough.

dialogues.text: One step. So I don’t gut myself. Cliff throws her a look. But -- a LITTLE GIRL’S LAUGH swi his attention back to the steps. But-- where is ghe...?

dialogues.text: What is it, Cliff?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I used to hold my daughter’s hands when she was learning to walk, she’d always want to go to the steps, always wanted to go up. And then she’d just stand there, and I'd get so frustrated, you know? Just walk up the steps. It’s the most normal goddamn thing in the world.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: So walk up the goddamn steps. Cliff looks down at the steps, but now: they’re the steps from home, and he sees his daughter CLARA between his leg arms outstretched, awaiting his help. Stunned, he pulls h hands from the guardrails, gingerly takes hers, her finge on his robot fingers. Cliff raises his left foot as she raises hers. Success. And now the right... as she raises hers... yes... Cliff can’t believe this is happening. He gives in to it-

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Clara) There ya go, baby girl. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: And now they land on step #2.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did it, Daddy! Cliff does that things dads do -- pretends like he’s a cheering crowd - the crowd roars! - as Clara giggles. We WIDEN, Larry and Rita share a satisfied look as Cliff his little celebration. INT. DOOM MANOR — HALLWAY ~ DAY — INTERCUT (1995 CLOSE ON - Cliff’s feet. He’s_ walking. And now, his face Head held high. INT. DOOM MANOR ~ CHIEF'S LAB — DAY (1995 Niles works. Hears a FAMILIAR WHIRR, looks up as Cliff enters. Niles smiles, deeply happy for him.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: My family thinks I died in a car crash seven years ago. My daughter’s grown up without a father. My wife’s probably moved on. But they deserve to know. And then they can decide what to do with it. (then) Thank you for everything you've done. But this isn’t me.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I am thrilled beyond belief for you that you are walking, that you finally feel like you. All I've wanted was to give you a gentle place to land, a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: And I appreciate that. Niles gestures to a TAPE RECORDER.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I think you’re ready to listen to this. (MORE)

dialogues.text: It's the phone message I used to re- create your voice. I think it will help you understand how your brain has been altering your memories to help you cope. (then) Unless. Maybe you’re not ready. A beat. Cliff pushes PLAY. That BEEP SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: {on the tape) I don’t know what happened to us. I’m going to be better. CLOSE ON THE TAPE RECORDER - Cliff pushes STOP. Then REWI His robot finger hovers over the PLAY button. Do I really want to hear this? And then he pushes PLAY again. As he does-— EXT. RACETRACK — DAY = FLASHBACK (1988 That RACE CAR flies end over end toward Cliff’s windshiel BUT: Cliff jerks the wheel at the last moment, narrowly avoids being hit! Emerges from the pile-up untouched! MOMENTS LATER. Cliff roars past the finish line in first! He slows the car to a stop. Pops his helmet visor open, s there for a moment, shaken. He’s yanked out of the car by his adoring pit crew. A MAG OF CHAMPAGNE is thrust into his hands as he spins to come face to face with an also-shaken Kate. For a brief moment we wonder if his near-death experience will bring them together... but then he raises the magnum and proceeds to wallop the living shit out of Bump Weathe as the crowd falls into a stunned silence. Cliff rears up, his face speckled with Bump’s blood, pops cork and sprays the shocked crowd while letting out a tot incongruous victory whoop.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeahhhhh! INT, HOTEL ROOM — NIGHT — FLASHBACK (1988 Cliff fucks Giselle again. J[t’s stylized, alcohol-fueled but, as we move closer to him, we see it for what it real is: rote, meaningless. The racing trophy sits on a chair. dialogues.text: Cliff sits on the edge of the bed, Giselle naked and slee next to him. He’s full of regret, tired, holds the phone his ear. A RECORDING MACHINE BEEPS.

dialogues.text: (into phone) I don’t know what happened to us. I’m going to be better, (then) I know it’s late--

dialogues.text: --Hello?

dialogues.text: Hey. Hi. (then) I don’t know if you even care how sorry I am.

The door opens, Kate carries a sleeping Clara past him to the car. INT. CLIFF/KATE’S CAR ~ NIGHT — FLASHBACK (1988 It’s a quiet ride, just a few long haul truckers on the r Kate stares out at the rising sun. Cliff looks at Clara i the backseat, Kate next to him. This is worth fighting fo

dialogues.text: (screaming) Cliff--1 cliff turns -- a SEMI looms in front of them! Cliff slams the breaks but it’s too late as-- CLIFF’S CAR CAREENS UNDER THE BACKSIDE OF THE SEMI-TRAILE (which has no under-ride bar) AS--

dialogues.text: --CLIFF/ROBOTMAN. PRESENT DAY. Still in Niles‘ lab. We're on the back of his head. PUSHING CLOSER... --THAT SHATTERED GLASS WINDSHIELD. Realize the hazy sunli filtering through was actually the flashlight beams of fi responders. --CLIFF/ROBOTMAN. PUSHING IN on his face...

dialogues.text: No. --INSIDE THE WRECKED CAR - CLIFF’S POV: Kate. Bloodied, d

dialogues.text: Kate... --INSIDE THE WRECKED CAR. CLIFF’S POV - Turning to look f Clara, gees her bloodied arm...

dialogues.speaker: --CLIFF/ROBOTMAN
dialogues.text: CLIFF (CONT’D) Oh, god, no. Clara. What happened to Clara!

dialogues.text: I'm afraid you were the only survivor.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Nol And now WE'RE SPIRALING AROUND CLIFF as he’s overtaken by emotion... which quickly rises to anger as he PUNCHES the first thing he sees, a MASSIVE METAL PLATE -- WHAM! And t plate buckles where his fist hit it -- and we're unexpect getting a glimpse of Cliff's raw robotic power -- as he lashes out at the metal plate - WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! - rendering it to a cauliflowered heap as we- GO TO RITA. Knitting. Hearing Cliff's screams. GO TO LARRY. Tending to his orchids inside a converted school bus. Hearing Cliff's screams. BACK ON CLIFF/ROBOTMAN. Lost. Standing there amongst the broken shards, as ALL SOUNDS DROPS OUT. Staring down -- there’s Clara again, holding his robot fingers as they wa up the steps, except now she lets go, keeps walking up th steps, into the light, the bright light. And she’s gone. DOOM MANOR — SOLARIUM ~ NIGHT (1995) Cliff slumps on the floor, bangs his head against the reh steps every few seconds. He stops when Niles arrives.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I can’t feel pain. Wo matter how hard I hit, where I hit, what I hit, I can’t feel pain. (then) That’s mighty shitty of you, Doc. And they sit there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff walks down the hallway. INT, DOOM MANOR - CLIFF’S ROOM — DAY (1995) Cliff enters, closes the door. Stands at the window. Utterly defeated. The spark gone out. And the years pass. A CHYRON in the corner of the screen ticks off each year: 1996, 1997, 1998...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And the years passed. And it’s all so depressing I just... can’t. ...1999, 2000, 2001... Larry enters with a cardboard box, places it in a corner. +++2002, 2003, 2004... Cliff opens the box. Pulls out a slot car. Looks off. ..+2005, 2006, 2007... Cliff looks again at the slot car. +++2008, 2009, 2010... Cliff builds crazily. Plywood tables, etc. ++e2011, 2012, 2013... We're riding with a slot car on a track... but as the car moves along, the scenery grows more elaborate -- we’re watching the creation of a fantastical slot car wonderlan happening over the years-- until, finally, we hit 2018. TV Calling - For educational purposes only  "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 INT. DOOM MANOR - CLIFF‘S ROOM ~ PRESENT DAY (2018 33. Cliff works his controller, proudly watches the cars run round the tracks. Rita knits. Larry carefully plants real miniature shrubs on the town's Main Street.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: That‘s a new building. Next to the police station. What's it say?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Library.

dialogues.text: Your handwriting is an abomination. Cliff meekly holds up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Robot fingers. They fall into silence. The cars go ‘round. Out in the hall, a COMMOTION. A WOMAN’S VOICE, irate. shares a knowing look with Larry. Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Oh, goody. She’s back.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Rita.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Comes and goes as she pleases. Like she owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Who? But Rita zips it. Cliff goes to the door. Opens it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who, indeed, There's lots of “who” with this one. DOWN THE HALL - Niles reasons with a LOUD WOMAN. Dark, Rita tangled locks, dark clothes -- like she spent the last we crowd-surfing a youth hostel. This is JANE, aka CRAZY JAN

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Meet Jane. Some people call her Crazy Jane. (MORE )

dialogues.text: TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 34.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One woman, 64 personas, each with its own special power. Put it this way -- Jane makes Sybil look like a piker. At the moment, Jane is HAMMERHEAD, a tough-talking brute.

dialogues.text: Help her. The Blob overtakes cars, anything in its path-- it threat to take down another building... cliff gets there in the of time, holds it in place as people inside can safely fl Jane stalks alongside the blob.

dialogues.text: Rita! Can you hear me? Rita! That’s not gonna work. Jane turns into Hammerhead.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rita, you fucking bitch! Get a fucking grip on yourself! Rita, from somewhere inside that blob:

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’m trying! BUT: the Blob is heading right for a SCHOOL BUS. Full of KIDS. Peril! As WE'RE WITH--

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Who rounds a corner, heads for the Doom Bus to make his getaway when his chest starts to BURN BRIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: No. No no no! I'm running away-- --as the NEGATIVE SPIRIT leaps out of him and Larry colla to the ground! The Negative Spirit whips back toward the chaos....

dialogues.speaker: TEE BLOB
dialogues.text: Crushes everything in its path. Nears that SCHOOL BUS...

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF AND JANE
dialogues.text: Move between the Blob and the bus. The last defense. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 53.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What do we do? Jane turns into SUN DADDY. Gonna do what we gotta do. CLIFF (CONT’D) No, we're not doing that! Cliff realizes: needs a better plan. He drops, digs BOTH ROBOT HANDS into the asphalt... and starts to push... ON THE BLOB. Taking out electrical poles, which spark and threaten to burn until-- THE NEGATIVE SPIRIT rushes throu them, the power extinguishes! ON CLIFF. Pushes that Asphalt into a GIANT MOUND... As the Blob reaches Cliff's barricade... starts to climb it... closer and closer to the peak... as Cliff hunches frozen against the other side, arms, propping that asphal up, the school bus just feet behind him... as now the blo reaches the very top... and stops. Quivering. Cliff doesn’t move. As then -- one piece of the blob slips over the side, dan like pulled taffy down to Cliff's face. Now we see in it: RITA’S DISTORTED, GROTESQUE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (quiet, desperate) I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (a beat) We can do that. INT. DOOM MANOR - SOLARIUM — NIGHT (2018 Rita stares off. Jane, Larry, each in his or her own spac Larry places a calming hand on Rita’s. She dutifully smil Cliff sits stock still. Coiled. INT./EXT. CHIEF’S CAR/TOWN - NIGHT (2018 It's later. Niles drives slowly through the aftermath. He passes a NEWS REPORTER doing a stand-up next to the mound asphalt created by Cliff, rolls down his window to catch- TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 54.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
dialogues.text: +.-apparently it was some sort of giant blob run amok, until what some witnesses described as a “robot man” created this barrier made of -- made of Main Street, Bill-- --as Niles reacts ~~ what the hell? -- and keeps driving through. Processing. Now he drives past what appears to b an ALBINO DONKEY standing between two buildings... catche just a flash of it, enough to-- SCREECH. He brakes, Backs up to look into the mouth of th alley. Nothing’s there. But whatever he may have seen... it’s spooked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang’s still here. The front door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Daddy‘s home. Cliff shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: INT, DOOM MANOR
dialogues.text: Niles wheels down the hallway. Stops at the doorway of th room where our foursome sit. Cliff stands waiting.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: We do. (to them all) I warned you not to leave. I begged you. You have no idea what you've done. Niles wheels away, backs into an ancient ELEVATOR, his ey on them, his disappointment plain.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (defiant) It wasn’t that bad! Larry clicks on the TV. The LOCAL NEWS plays IMAGES OF TODAY'S CHAOS. WE SEE the Reporter we saw before. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 55.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
dialogues.text: “Bad" doesn’t begin to describe what befell Covington today, Rob. Horrible. Destructive. Chaotic. Just a few words used by locals to describe what they saw: The FOOTAGE CUTS to a MAN-ON-THE-STREET interview.

dialogues.speaker: MAN-ON-THE-STREET
dialogues.text: Look, I‘1l be honest, I used to get jealous, how all the “heroes” ignored the fly-over towns like us, but come on, you‘’re gonna send something extra human to a place like this? Send the Justice League, man. Not the short bus. The team absorbs that. They’re losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niles enters. Crosses to a LOCKED DOOR. He pulls off a necklace tucked under his shirt. Attached to the necklace a key, which he uses to open the door. There’s another th attached to it as well -- a SMALL, BLACKENED KNOT of... something. He steps into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Niles’ Map Room, his nerve center. Where a man, i he so wanted, could covertly monitor weird shit from arou the world. Not a modern space. The machinery and cabinets are vintage, think ‘Darkest Hour’. This is his secret space. With lots of places to hold his secrets -- old journals, wooden file cabinets, a reel-to- tape recorder, an 8mm projector, ham radio, etc. Niles hustles to a cabinet, pulls from a dusty box a leat satchel. Which we might recognize from our prologue ~~ th was Mr. Morden's satchel. He pulls out 8x10 BLACK AND WHI SURVEILLANCE PHOTOS --~ there’s the Paraguayan boy, there Von Fuchs... and there‘s that ALBINO DONKEY. The very sam one he just saw in town. Why does Niles have pictures of 1948 Paraguay? And why is he so spooked by what he sees? INT. DOOM MANOR — SOLARIUM - NIGHT (2018 Niles sits in front of them, grave. Cliff paces.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there’s no choice. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 56,

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: There’s always a choice.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Not today. Not after what you did.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We took a drive. Niles does his utmost best not to explode.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: You - whether you realize it or not - your actions - your actions have consequences and those consequences are coming. Of that there is no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You really think we’re in danger, Chief. That we need to pick up and run. This is what you really, really think.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: As far away as possible. As soon as we can.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What happens to the town.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: The town is not my concern.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So the town gets screwed.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: (now he explodes) You've done quite enough to the town, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Don’t you start with me, too. When you and I both know this field trip was for little more than your own amusement. Jane retreats - stung by the truth of that. TV Calling - For educational purposes only

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 57.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So now she’s the bad guy. Okay. Let's talk about you, Chief. (then) You told me my daughter was dead. Niles is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I was trying to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: By lying.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I'm trying to protect you now. (then) Do you honestly think she would have accepted you?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Did I get a chance to try? She lost her mother, her father, I don’t know if she would have accepted me. You robbed me of that chance. What am I to her now? I‘m nothing. I’m a monster. A beat. Niles softens.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I assure you, there are many monsters in this world, and none of them - not a one - is you. (then) There are things out there I’ve tried to warn you about. Many of them, if I’m being totally honest, might be considered my enemies. (as this sinks in) Who, if they found me, would not hesitate - in any way ~ to destroy me and those I love. And, yes, the town if -- well, just because. (then) I've tried so hard to shield you. And I know what I am asking of you. To leave the safest place you've ever known. To step out into a world that would rather ignore you. Shun you. Belittle you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 58.

dialogues.speaker: NILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But - if you stay here - if we die now - this magical experiment, this - you - my life accomplishments all, it just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands flutter in orbit for a lost moment -- it all di

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Or. We stay. And we fight.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: We could. (then) And we'd be doomed.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What are we now? Both men’s words hang over the room.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I’m going to go with the Chief. Larry exits.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Agreed. (to Cliff) You were good today, Cliff. And I thank you. She exits as well. All eyes on Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Fuck it. She exits. Cliff’s not sure what that means. Niles is. A few moments later she returns, duffel in hand.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the Chief) Shotgun. Jane walks out, no ceremony. Cliff stands there. Gut-punc EXT. ROAD — NIGHT (2018 Big, empty shot. Cliff walks along the side of the road. Alone. Toward town. Behind him, the Doom Bus pulls out, turns the opposite wa TV Calling - For educational purposes only  "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Rita can’t help but watch Cliff’s receding figure. Turns back, worried for him. Niles gives her a small smile, This is the right thing. Cliff recedes in the sideview mirror. Jane never looks. EXT. TOWN ~— NIGHT (2018 The town is quiet. Nothing seems amiss. TWO TRASH HAULERS throw debris into their truck. Cliff approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Hey. (then) Seen anything weird? The Trash Haulers stare.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (2018)
dialogues.text: Jane sings along to the tune on the radio, then falls sil Each of them has fallen off into their own thoughts. Perhaps... second thoughts. EXT, TOWN STREET — NIGHT (2018 Cliff walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dane drives. Her hand bangs anxiously against the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Anyone else think Cliff was right about saving that town?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: It's over, Jane. Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Okay, except I vote we turn around.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Rita? TV Calling - For educational purposes only

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 60.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I can’t promise I won't, you know, “blob out”, but - yes.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Larry? Larry doesn’t answer, head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Larry’s a yes.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Whoo! Jane fishtails the bus into a turn. EXT. TOWN — NIGHT (2018 Cliff walks. As the DOOM BUS pulls up alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOOM BUS
dialogues.text: Jane, Larry and Rita exit the bus. Rita hesitates. Shares moment with Niles.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: This is wrong. Rita gives him a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Might be. Probably is. We’1l be back. And she goes.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CLIFF
dialogues.text: Quietly moved as they approach. He gives them a small nod starts off again, toward town. They walk with him. Rita’s leg swells - a sign of her anxiety - but Larry tou her arm, gives her a nod. She smiles, gamely shuffles on.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And there they go, our four lovable losers, banding together to become the superhero fighting force no one Saw coming except everybody. (then) But. Fear not. Hope blooms. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot" Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 61.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s a way out of this dreck, follow me. As our team marches on... and THE GROUND BEGINS TO RUMBLE ON THE DOOM BUS ~— INTERCUT Niles reacts. Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Paraguay.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Niles! Paraguay. Niles turns to see a MAN that looks sort of like... Mr. Morden? He’s half-man, half-nothing, of this world and no Also, he’s got a new name. He’s MR. NOBODY now. And he’s apparently been our Narrator for this entire story.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY
dialogues.text: Always, Paraguay.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Morden.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY
dialogues.text: Sure. But no. I haven’t been Mr. Morden since, well, (mock screams) “Ahh! Help me! WNoooo!” We have no idea what he means. But Niles does.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE DOOM PATROL
dialogues.text: As the ground rumbles around them--

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It’s fine. It’s totally fine. --Clip clop clip clop... That ALBINO DONKEY rounds a corn stops, looks at them askance. They stare back. The Donkey farts white smoke. Which drifts up into the ai forms into letters and words, like some twisted sky-writi The words float high above them: THE... MIND... IS... THE... LIMIT... They stare. Awed, unsure. TV Calling - For educational purposes only (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pilot"

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Limited Studio Draft 7/6/18 62. (2)

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I’ve been admiring your friends, Niles, those freaks of yours, for quite some time.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Don't you dare hurt them.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hurt them? No. That wouldn't be much fun, would it? Would be quite the same old story, actually. I think we’ll try something different this time,

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You were right about them in one respect, however. THE RUPTURE OPENS FURTHER - like something was opening a zipper in the middle of town - HEADS RIGHT FOR OUR TEAM--

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR/MR. NOBODY
dialogues.text: They are quite doomed. --Growing bigger, more ferocious, more foreboding, as our foursome stands in its path, unsure what they are looking unsure what to do, AS WE-- CUT TO BLACK. TV Calling - For educational purposes only
